activities: CFS Clinical use personal information that it receives from the EU/Switzerland primarily for (1) customer support activities, such as answering inquiries, providing technical support and improving product offerings; (2) sales and marketing activities as permissible under applicable law; (3) carrying out services as contracted by its clients; and (4) internal business processes such as financial processing and management, fraud detection and prevention, and compliance with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
privacyprograms: self-regulatory privacy program that adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) will be used for any unresolved complains involving residents of their respective jurisdictions.
